MESSAGE.name: DjVuDecode.bad_crop_win
MESSAGE.value: [1-%0!05u!] Cropping window outside the bounds of the image

MESSAGE.name: DjVuDecode.crop_height
MESSAGE.value: [1-%0!05u!] Crop height outside image boundary, reducing it to %1!d!

MESSAGE.name: DjVuDecode.crop_width
MESSAGE.value: [1-%0!05u!] Crop width outside image boundary, reducing it to %1!d!

MESSAGE.name: DjVuDecode.no_decode
MESSAGE.value: [1-%0!05u!] No pages have been decoded. Try verbose mode for details.

MESSAGE.name: DjVuProcess.bad_number
MESSAGE.value: [1-%0!05u!] TARGET page number is out of range.

MESSAGE.name: DjVuProcess.need_range
MESSAGE.value: [1-%0!05u!] Page range is required with OLD_INDIRECT documents.

MESSAGE.name: DjVuProcess.no_indirect
MESSAGE.value: [1-%0!05u!] Indirect documents are not supported with djvu_import types.

MESSAGE.name: DjVuProcess.not_djvu
MESSAGE.value: [1-%0!05u!] Input %1!s! (type %2!s!) is not a DjVu file

MESSAGE.name: DjVuTransform.bad_angle
MESSAGE.value: [1-%0!05u!] The rotate angle must be a multiple of 90 degrees

MESSAGE.name: DjVuTransform.bad_crop
MESSAGE.value: [1-%0!05u!] Cropping window outside the bounds of the image

MESSAGE.name: DjVuTransform.bad_dpi
MESSAGE.value: [1-%0!05u!] DPI must be between 25 and 1200 inclusively.

MESSAGE.name: DjVuTransform.bad_geom
MESSAGE.value: [1-%0!05u!] Crop option is badly formed or outside the bounds of the image

BODY.MESSAGE: %1!s!=<format> Selected Desired output format of pnm, pgm, pbm, bmp, tif, jpeg, ps, pict.
%1!s!=<layer> Select the layer to decode. One of all, mask, foreground, background.
%1!s!=<range> Specify the ranges of pages to convert. Ranges are specified like "1-5,10,11".
%1!s!=<angle> Rotate the output either 90, 180, or 270 clockwise.

MESSAGE.name: --togray
MESSAGE.value: %1!s! If input is color, reduce to gray scale.

MESSAGE.name: --upsample
MESSAGE.value: %1!s!=<factor> Upsample the image by the specified factor.

MESSAGE.name: --subsample
MESSAGE.value: %1!s!=<factor> Subsample the image by the specified factor.

BODY.MESSAGE: %1!s!=<width>x<height> Resize the image to the specified size.
%1!s!=<x0>,<y0>,<width>x<height> Crop the image to the specified region.
